meanings.definition: Having small wrinkles or waves on the surface.
meanings.sent1: The crinkly paper made a noise when I touched it.
meanings.sent2: She loved the crinkly sound of the leaves under her feet.
meanings.sent3: The crinkly wrapping paper made the gift look extra special.
meanings.sent4: Her crinkly smile showed years of laughter and joy.
meanings.sent5: The crinkly fabric felt rough against my skin.

meanings.definition: To make small wrinkles or waves on the surface.
meanings.sent1: I crinkly the paper to add texture to my art project.
meanings.sent2: The wind crinkly the leaves as it blew through the trees.
meanings.sent3: She crinkly the edges of the paper to create a unique design.
meanings.sent4: His laughter crinkly his eyes at the corners.
meanings.sent5: The heat crinkly the plastic wrap, distorting its shape.
